posts.name: TechCabal
posts.cooked:
"His name is David Obasiolu, and it all started with one tweet. @markessien you're a lucky man making hotels.ng when I was only 16. I would have made that in 2 days and pushed you out of business lol. — David Obasiolu (@Obazzy_Dave) April 12, 2016 …and a reply from Mark Essien, founder & CEO…"

Continue reading the full article on TechCabal

link_counts.title: This guy built a Hotel-booking platform in 2 days, after Mark Essien challenged him

posts.name: Ernest Ojeh
posts.cooked:
LOL. This is so funny to me. I think he's just trolling.
--
Btw, the site is actually a wordpress theme: http://themeforest.net/item/traveler-multipurpose-booking-template/8526796. Demo: http://remtsoy.com/tf_templates/traveler/demo_v1_7/index.html

link_counts.title: Traveler - Multipurpose Booking Template - Site Templates

posts.name: Bankole Oluwafemi
posts.cooked: His initiative/chutzpah is interesting, but he's a touch high on his own kool aid, like is kinda the thing with rookies. It's actually a necessary rookie trait, to be honest, experience makes people risk averse, which makes the already slim odds of achieving greatness even slimmer. And assuming he's really serious about this, he won't be the first or last Wordpress startup. Lol.

posts.name: Sola Akindolu
posts.cooked: He needs to chill, and get the job Mark is offering. But I bet he won't listen. Initial gra-gra.

posts.name: Meed Ubarab
posts.cooked: There's force in this... Funny but damn serious! I am setting an alert till Afrivac launches...

posts.name: Osarumen Osamuyi
posts.cooked: Actually, I assume Mark offered him a job because of his UI design skills (which we now know he doesn't have). Right now, I'm not sure what he's going to add to Hotels.ng.

posts.name: Victor Iniemogha
posts.cooked: How do I get the theme for my new site www.roomsbot.com

posts.name: Ikenna Darlington
posts.cooked:
SkweiRd:

I assume Mark offered him a job because of his UI design skills

From the exchange, I believe he was offered the Job based on grit and commitment.

Also from his LinkedIn profile,he is not really into design but Software development.

posts.name: No Name
posts.cooked: Too much of themeforest i suppose ?

posts.name: Osarumen Osamuyi
posts.cooked: This makes sense, @Idarlington. You're right.

posts.name: Shalvah Adebayo
posts.cooked:
Correction: This guy built a website in two days.

After seeing the post title and his tweet, I expected to see a platform of hotels.ng-type quality all set and ready to compete in two days. Ludicrous, I know. But he said it, not me.
I wish him all the best, really. Seasoned entrepreneurs know that it's not just about launching a site.

posts.name: Sani Abubakar Sadiq
posts.cooked: probably he hasnt taken any serious risk in his life, he should be allowed to get his fingers burnt a little

posts.name: Stephen Igwue
posts.cooked: Well... when you're 90% done, get ready for the second 90%.

link_counts.title: When you’re 90% done, get ready for the second 90% — Medium

posts.name: Davis Ceejay
posts.cooked: I love his spirit and can do atitude. Right now it's not about if he can take his idea off the ground but his energy and believe in himself and ability to even try to push forward.

posts.cooked:

posts.cooked: lol... Funny but then, let us see what he has in stock for us.

posts.name: Taslim OKUNOLA
posts.cooked: Hehehe. WordPress startups are killing it too oh. In their own space sha.

posts.name: Howard Sherman
posts.cooked: Three words: TAKE THE JOB!

posts.cooked:
Kinda of thirsty, that the first guy you go singing to is Eghosa from Echo VC, Hotel.ng backers.

Manquant finesse!
